title: fn_ARSS {Morefi}
text: function fn_ARSS perform Coincident Curves Test, determine significant differences fitted curves database. based Analysis Residual Sum Squares (ARSS) (Chen et al. 1992). F=RSSp−RSSs3•(K−1)RSSsN−3•KF=\frac{\frac{RSS_{p}-RSS_{s}}{3\bullet \left( K-1 \right)}}{\frac{RSS_{s}}{N-3\bullet K}} RSSpRSS_{p}= RSS regression fitted pooled data, RSSsRSS_{s}= sum RSS regression fitted individual sample, N= total sample size, K = number samples comparison. residual sum squares (RSS) degrees freedom (DF) fitted regression previously stored List_TCCT list. regression, calculations stored data frame T1, stored iteratively using loop list T. Inside function, RSS DF joined sample calculated perform F test two tails α/2\alpha/2. decision criteria performed: “*” p−value≤αp-value\le \alpha “NS” p−val>αp-val\gt \alpha. function requires defining: List_TCCT: list fitted regression results. : integer value indicating ith regression analyzed. alfa: numerical value defines significance level. default number 0.05. Seealso: FDist package stats (version 3.6.2)

title: fn_ARSS {Morefi}
text: function included Morefi package Morphological Relationships Fitted Robust Regression. function detailed .
code: library(Morefi) fn_ARSS <- function(List_TCCT, i,  alfa= 0.05){   T  <- list()   for (i in 1:length(List_TCCT)){      T1 <- List_TCCT[[i]]   lvar <- names(List_TCCT[i])    T1[1,1] <- paste0(substr(lvar,1,2)," vs. ",                     substr(lvar,3,nchar(lvar)))   # RSSs sum of the RSS of each regression fitted   T1[4,3] <- round(sum(as.numeric(T1[1,3]),                        as.numeric(T1[2,3])),2)    # DF Sum GL1 + GL2   T1[4,4] <- sum(as.numeric(T1[1,4]),as.numeric(T1[2,4]))    # F calculated (Fc)   T1[1,5] <- round(abs((as.numeric(T1[3,3])-as.numeric(T1[4,3]))/                          as.numeric(T1[4,3])),4)    # F table (critical value)   T1[1,6] <- round(qf(alfa, as.numeric(T1[3,4]),                       as.numeric(T1[4,4]),                       lower.tail= FALSE),4)    # p-value for two tails   P_value <- pf(as.numeric(T1[1,6]),                 as.numeric(T1[4,4]),                 as.numeric(T1[3,4]),                 lower.tail=FALSE)    T1[1,7] <- if(P_value>1-alfa){     "p>0.95"   } else {     format(P_value, format= "e", digits = 4)   } # End if    # Decision criteria   T1[1,8] <-  if(P_value>alfa){     "NS"   } else {     "*"   } # End if   T[[i]] <- as.data.frame(T1)   } # End for   return(T) }  # End function

title: fn_ARSS {Morefi}
text: length-weight estimated Pacific Sierra Scomberomorus sierra sex total sample (Unpublish data). sex 362 organisms determined: 95 females 118 males. adjusted models show following data: Females SSR= 1557970.877 DF= 93; Males SSR= 1188689.721 DF= 116; total sample SSR= 2045176.876 DF= 211. Values stored table Table_CC, stored list, name item built acronyms model variables (e.g. LTWT). [[1]] Model Category RSS DF ARSS F-table p-value Criteria 1 LT vs. WT Females 1557971 93 0.2554 1.2556 0.04988 * 2  Males 1188690 116 NA NA  3  Total 2045177 211 NA NA  4  Joined 2746661 209 NA NA
code: Table_CC <- data.frame(matrix(NA,nrow=4,ncol=8)) Table_CC[1,1] <- "Lt-WT"  Table_CC[,2] <- c("Females","Males","Total","Joined") colnames(Table_CC) <- c("Model","Category","RSS","DF","ARSS","F-table","p-value","Criteria")  Table_CC[1,3] <- 1557970.877 Table_CC[1,4] <-  93  Table_CC[2,3] <- 1188689.721 Table_CC[2,4] <-  116  Table_CC[3,3] <- 2045176.876 Table_CC[3,4] <-  211    List_ARSS <- list(LTWT=Table_CC)  i <- 1  ARSS <- fn_ARSS(List_ARSS, i,  alfa= 0.05) ARSS

previous_headings: Robust version of the coefficient of determination
title: fn_R2RV {Morefi}
text: function calculates robust version coefficient determination RRV2R^{2}_{RV} using Equation Summary values fitted robustbase::nlrob() function. consistency corrected robust coefficient determination Renaud Victoria-Feser (2010) allows possible correction factor consistency considerations. Inside function: vectors observed (y1), predicted (yc) weighted (W) values obtained summary model (eq). value Weighted Estimate Average (ywea), modified sum squares explained (SSEw), total (SSTw), residual (SSRw) estimated. correction factor value consistency considerations 95 percent also obtained summary model (eq). vector robust version coefficient determination R2wa adjusted value R2wa_adj returned vector. function, following estimated: Weighted Estimate Average ŷ¯w\overline{\widehat{y}}_{w} (called ywea). ŷ¯w=(1/Σwi)×Σwiŷ\overline{\widehat{y}}_{w}=\left(1/\Sigma w_{}\right)\times \Sigma w_{} \widehat{y}_{} modified sum squares explained SSEw SSEw=∑wi(ŷ−ŷ¯w)2)SSEw= \sum_{}^{}w_{}(\widehat{y}_{}-\overline{\widehat{y}}_{w}) ^2) modified sum squared residuals SSRw SSRw=∑wi(y1i−ŷ)2)SSRw= \sum_{}^{}w_{}(y1_{}-\widehat{y}_{}) ^2) robust version coefficient determination Rw,a2R^{2}_{w,}Rw,a2=SSEwSSEw+×SSRwR^{2}_{w,}=\frac{SSEw}{SSEw+\times SSRw} adjusted coefficient determination Radj,w,a2R^{2}_{adj,w,}Radj,w,a2=1−(1−Rw,a2)×(n−1n−q)R^{2}_{adj,w,}=1- \left(1- R^{2}_{w,}\right)\times \left( \frac{n-1 }{n-q} \right) y1iy1_{}, ŷ\widehat{y}_{} ithi_{th} observed predicted values, aa correction factor value consistency considerations 95 percent, nn number pairs observations qq number variables included model. function requires defining: eq: Summary equation fitted using robustbase::nlrob() function. function returns vector robust version coefficient determination Rw,a2R^{2}_{w,} adjusted value Radj,w,a2R^{2}_{adj,w,}.

previous_headings: Robust version of the coefficient of determination
title: fn_R2RV {Morefi}
text: function included Morefi package Morphological Relationships Fitted Robust Regression. function detailed .
code: library(Morefi) fn_R2RV <- function(eq){       w <- eq$rweights   # w a vector of weights values       yc <- eq$fitted.values # yc a vector of predicted values       ywea <-  (1/sum(w)) * sum(w*yc) # a value of the Weighted Estimate Average       y1 <- eq$model[,1]       SSEw <- sum(w*(yc-ywea)^2)       SSRw <- sum(w*(y1-yc)^2)       a <- environment(eq[["psi"]])[["cc"]]       R2wa <- SSEw/(SSEw+a*SSRw)       R2wa_adj <- 1-(1-R2wa)*((length(y1)-1)/summary(eq)$df[2])       R2was <- c(R2wa,R2wa_adj)       print(R2was)     }

previous_headings: Robust version of the coefficient of determination
title: fn_R2RV {Morefi}
text: execute, ’s just syntax example.
code: R2RV <- fn_R2RV(eq)

previous_headings: Robust version of the coefficient of determination
title: fn_R2RV {Morefi}
text: Renaud, O., & Victoria-Feser, M. P. (2010). robust coefficient determination regression. Journal Statistical Planning Inference, 140(7), 1852-1862. doi:10.1016/j.jspi.2010.01.008.

previous_headings: Customize the appearance of the plot
title: fn_figs {Morefi}
text: function creates customized scatter plot observed values (points), fitted regression (solid line) confidence interval (shaded area) using package ggplot2. function use theme_papers() customize appearance plot. function returns plot. function requires defining: datos: data frame containing values : independent variable (x); dependent (y) adjusted (yc) variable; Fleet (factor) CIPI: data frame containing seseqquence independent variable; fitted independent variable confidence predicted intervals (lowest highest value). : integer value indicating regression analyzed modelos: list variables (integer values) used regression model. etiquetas: list indicating labels axes (name variable unit measurement). See also: ggplot2 (version 3.4.4) See also: theme_papers(): customized present work fn_figs function included Morefi package Morphological Relationships Fitted Robust Regression. function detailed .
code: fn_figs <- function(datos, CIPI, i, etiquetas, modelos){           Fig <- ggplot(CIPI,aes(x = CIPI[,1])) +                  geom_ribbon(aes(x = CIPI[,1], ymin = CIPI[,3], ymax = CIPI[,4],                                  fill = "aquamarine"), alpha = 1/50)    +                  geom_ribbon(aes(x = CIPI[,1], ymin = CIPI[,5], ymax = CIPI[,6],                                  fill = "grey", alpha = 1/50)) +                  geom_line(aes(x= CIPI[,1], y = CIPI[,2])) +                  geom_point(datos, mapping=aes(x= datos[,1], y = datos[,2],                                  shape = factor(datos[,4]), stroke = 1,                                  fill = datos[,4]), alpha = 1/10)+                  labs(tag = letters[i],x= etiquetas[modelos[[i]][1]],                                  y = etiquetas[modelos[[i]][2]])           print(Fig) }   # End fn_figs

previous_headings: Customize the appearance of the plot
title: fn_figs {Morefi}
text: total 100 simulated data total length cm (LT) total weight (g) data hypothetical fish species. x values range 15 60 cm. parameters potential model : ordinate = 0.011 slope = 2.5. values observed y calculated using parameters potential equation plus random number -20 20. lower CIl upperCIu confidence interval values calculated using Standard Error Estimate SE. execute, ’s just syntax example.
code: set.seed(123) rvar <- sample(-20:20, 100, replace=TRUE) x <- sample(15:60,100,replace=T) y <- (0.011*x^2.5)+rvar n <- length(x) Fleet <- as.factor(sample(1:2,100,replace = TRUE))  yc <- 0.011*x^2.5 datos <- data.frame(x1=x,y1=y,yc=yc,Fleet=Fleet)  # CI & PI  MSE <- sum((y-yc)^2)/(100-2)  xseq <- seq(15,60, by=2.5) yseq <- 0.011*xseq^2.5  CP <- (1/n)+(((xseq-mean(xseq))^2)/sum((xseq-mean(xseq))^2))  ICl <- yseq -(1.96*(sqrt(MSE*CP))) ICu <- yseq +(1.96*(sqrt(MSE*CP)))  IPl <- yseq -(1.96*(sqrt(MSE*(1+CP)))) IPu <- yseq +(1.96*(sqrt(MSE*(1+CP))))  df <- as.data.frame(cbind(xseq, yseq, ICl,ICu, IPl, IPu))                     colnames(df) <- c("x1", "fit","IC_L","IC_U", "IP_L","IP_U")  CIPI <- df  i <- 1  # To create the List etiquetas   lLT <- "LT (cm)" lWT <- "WT (g)"  etiquetas <- list(lLT,lWT)  #To carry out each of the regressions, a list `modelos` is created to indicate  #the variables that will be taken into account.  modelos <- list (LTvs.WT  =  c(1,2))  library(ggplot2)  FY <- fn_figs(datos, CIPI, i, etiquetas, modelos)

title: fn_freq {Morefi}
text: function fn_freq calculates frequency distribution data using functions: cut() table() R base. Inside function: non-cumulative absolute frequency calculated user-defined class interval within breaks object. breaks object must defined outside function user. example sequence breakpoints equal distance used. table frequencies class interval returned. function requires defining: df: vector data values. breaks: vector class intervals. right: Logical, indicating intervals closed right (open left) vice versa. Seealso: cut() table() R base package.

title: fn_freq {Morefi}
text: function included Morefi package Morphological Relationships Fitted Robust Regression. function detailed .
code: library(Morefi) fn_freq <- function(df, breaks, right=FALSE){                     df <- df                     breaks  <-  breaks                     fcut  <-  cut(df, breaks, right= right)                     freq <- table(fcut)                     }

title: fn_freq {Morefi}
code: df <- runif(n=30, min=0, max=1) breaks <- seq(0, 1, by= 0.1)  freq <- fn_freq(df, breaks, right= FALSE) freq

title: fn_freq {Morefi}
text: Yau C (2024, deck 25). Frequency Distribution Quantitative Data. R Tutorial R Introduction Statistics. https://www.r-tutor.com/elementary-statistics/quantitative-data/frequency-distribution-quantitative-data

title: fn_freqw {Morefi}
text: function fn_freqw methodological function calculate percentage frequencies weights model adjusted using robust regression approach. function calculates relative frequency distribution using function fn_freq Morefi package. fn_freq, breaks object must defined. work, sequence breakpoints equal distance used. incorporate number non-weighted values (wi=1)(w_{}=1), class interval 1 added sequence. table frequencies class interval returned. function requires defining: df: vector data values. breaks: vector class intervals. right: Logical, indicating intervals closed right (open left) vice versa. Seealso: cut() table() functions R base package. : fn_freq Morefi package

title: fn_freqw {Morefi}
text: function included Morefi package Morphological Relationships Fitted Robust Regression. function detailed .
code: library(Morefi) fn_freqw <- function(df, breaks, right=FALSE){                     freq <- fn_freq(df, breaks, right=FALSE)                     nw <- length(which(df ==1))                     freq <- c(freq, nw)                     freq <-  100*freq/length(df)                     }

title: fn_freqw {Morefi}
text: “df” object, 30 random values 0.1 0.9 generated five values equal 1 added. breaks object sequence equal distances, incorporate number non-weighted values (wi=1), class interval “1” added sequence. [0.1,0.2) [0.2,0.3) [0.3,0.4) [0.4,0.5) [0.5,0.6) [0.6,0.7) [0.7,0.8) [0.8,0.9) 11.428571 5.714286 5.714286 11.428571 2.857143 11.428571 11.428571 5.714286 [0.9,1) 5.714286 14.285714
code: df <- c(runif(n=30, min=0, max=1),rep(1,5)) breaks  <-  c(seq(0.1,0.9, by=0.1),1)  freq <- fn_freqw(df, breaks, right=FALSE) freq

title: fn_fyield {Morefi}
text: function calculates fillet yield dividing defined weight reference point bm mean, lower, upper confidence interval 95% (IC95%) estimated fillet weight, respectively. values obtained list items l_intervals$CI returned function Morefi::fn_intervals(). analyzed regression fillet weight independent variable, values calculated. “statement” written propose. Fillet yield calculated sequence independent variable (including minimum maximum values). Inside function, mean (Ymean), lower (Ymin), upper (Ymax) CI95% stored table (Table_Y). function requires defining: : integer value indicates regression analysis use. bm: integer value used benchmark. df: data frame landed weights category. Seealso: fn_intervals(): customized present package mutate(): package dplyr (version 1.0.10)

title: fn_fyield {Morefi}
text: function included Morefi package Morphological Relationships Fitted Robust Regression. function detailed .
code: library(Morefi) fn_fyield <- function(i,bm,df){                   Table_Y <- df                   Table_Y <- dplyr::mutate(Table_Y,                                            Yfit=   bm/Table_Y[,2],                                            YIC_L=  bm/Table_Y[,3],                                            YIC_U=  bm/Table_Y[,4],                                            YIP_L=  bm/Table_Y[,5],                                            YIP_U=  bm/Table_Y[,6]                                            )                   return(Table_Y)             }   # End fn

title: fn_fyield {Morefi}
text: execute, ’s just syntax example.
code: FY <- fn_fyield(i,bm,df)

title: fn_intervals {Morefi}
text: function calculates non parametric confidence predicted intervals using function predFit package investr (version 1.4.2) function requires defining: xseq: vector sequence independent variable. eq: Summary equation fitted. function return data frame df xseq (x1), fitted values dependent variable (fit), low upper confident (IC_L IC_U) predicted intervals (IP_L IP_U). seealso: predFit() package investr (version 1.4.2)

title: fn_intervals {Morefi}
text: function included Morefi package Morphological Relationships Fitted Robust Regression. function detailed .
code: library(Morefi) fn_intervals <- function(eq,xseq){                     new.data <- as.data.frame(xseq)                     str(predFit(eq, new.data, se.fit = TRUE))                     CI95 <- predFit(eq, newdata = new.data,                                     interval = "confidence",level=0.95)                     PI95 <- predFit(eq, newdata = new.data,                                     interval = "prediction",level=0.95)                      df <- as.data.frame(cbind(xseq,CI95,PI95[,-1]))                     colnames(df) <- c("x1", "fit","IC_L","IC_U", "IP_L","IP_U")                     df                     }

title: fn_intervals {Morefi}
text: execute, ’s just syntax example.
code: IC <- fn_intervals(eq,xseq)

previous_headings: Customizes the summary of fitted regression
title: fn_summary {Morefi}
text: Table T1 customized table store regression summarized model landed weight categories: Fresh, Frozen-thawed (Frozen) Total. 95% confidence interval parameter parentheses. adjusted robust version coefficient determination. (R2) Degrees Freedom (DF) also reported. List_Tables contains empty T1 element (model) function requires defining: List_Tables: list store summary regression results. modelos: character vector containing variables function. catego: character vector containing landed weight categories. eq: Summary equation fitted. R2: numeric value adjusted robust version coefficient determination. : integer value indicating ith regression analyzed. j: integer value indicating jth categorie analyzed. List_Tables customized table stores regression summary model. seealso: lmrob() nlrob() robustbase (version 0.99-0)

previous_headings: Customizes the summary of fitted regression
title: fn_summary {Morefi}
text: function included Morefi package (Morphological fit). function detailed .
code: library(Morefi) fn_summary <- function(List_Tables, modelos, catego, eq, R2, i, j){    T1 <- List_Tables[[i]]   lvar <- names(List_Tables[i])    T1[1,1] <- ifelse (i<7,"Linear","Potential")   T1[1,2] <- paste0(substr(lvar,1,2)," vs. ",                     substr(lvar,3,nchar(lvar)))   T1[j,3] <- catego[j]   T1[j,4] <- eq$coefficients[1]                          # b0   T1[j,5] <- paste0("(",round(confint.default(eq)[1,1],2)," to ",                     round(confint.default(eq)[1,2],2), ")") #b0 IC95%   T1[j,6] <- eq$coefficients[2]   T1[j,7] <- paste0("(",round(confint.default(eq)[2,1],2)," to ",                     round(confint.default(eq)[2,2],2), ")")   T1[j,8] <- as.numeric(R2)   T1[j,9] <- summary(eq)$df[2]    print(T1[j,])  } # End fn_summary

previous_headings: Customizes the summary of fitted regression
title: fn_summary {Morefi}
text: execute, ’s just syntax example.
code: T1 <- fn_summary(List_Tables, modelos, catego, eq, R2, i, j)

Inside function, appropriate sequence selected function model mean Ymean, lower Ymin, upper Ymax CI95% stored table Table_Y function requires defining: modelos: list defines variables taken account model. List_x_seq: list store sequence independent variable considered ith fitted model. : integer value indicating regression analyzed. function returns one-column data frame sequence selected. seealso: seq() base (version 4.3.0)

previous_headings: Customizes the summary of fitted regression
title: fn_xseq  {Morefi}
text: function included Morefi package Morphological Relationships Fitted Robust Regression. function detailed .
code: library(Morefi) fn_xseq <- function(modelos,List_x_seq, i) {   if (modelos[[i]][1]== 1) {     xseq <- List_x_seq[[1]]   } else {       if (modelos[[i]][1]== 2) {              xseq <- List_x_seq[[2]]       } else {             if (modelos[[i]][1]== 4) {                   xseq <- List_x_seq[[3]]             } else {                   xseq <- List_x_seq[[4]]       }  # End if                       }  # End if   }  # End if   xseq <- data.frame(x1=xseq) } # End fn

previous_headings: Customizes the summary of fitted regression
title: fn_xseq  {Morefi}
text: execute, ’s just syntax example.
code: xseq <- fn_xseq(modelos,List_x_seq, i)

title: Morphological Relationships Fitted by Robust Regression
text: Morefi package: Morphological Relationships Fitted Robust Regression. methodological package developed R analyze submitted article: Aguirre-Villaseñor, H., Morales-Bojórquez, E., Cisneros-Mata (FISH13711).Biometric relationships fisheries management tool: case study bullseye puffer (Sphoeroides annulatus. Tetraodontidae). Fisheries Research. fisheries monitoring, body length commonly measured parameter quick easy obtain. contrast, measuring weight requires level stable scale, can difficult secure field sampling. Biometric relationships crucial fisheries biology. accurately calculated, relationships can useful management purposes, especially estimating organism’s total length weight based body measurements. Many species marketed artisanal fishing various commercial forms. However, currently biometric relationships allow predicting live weight (total weight fish) different categories landed weight, fillet weight, gutted weight, frozen weight. objective package provide quantitative models various morphological relationships help predict: ) expected live weight different landed weight categories, b) expected fillet yield various commercial presentations, c) testing suitability fillet yield reference point managing target species. purpose, functions vignette created explain process step step. implementation streamlines methodology enhances clarity impact results graphical presentations (tables figures personalized). functions included Morefi package enable evaluation length-length, weight-weight length-weight biometric relationships using data exhibit high variability meet assumptions necessary adjustment via least squares. Given variability, robust regression method employed analysis. “robustbase” package (version 0.99-2) utilized fit robust regression models, using functions lmrob() linear nlrob() non-linear regression (Maechler et al., 2024).

title: Morphological Relationships Fitted by Robust Regression
text: can install development version Morefi GitHub using one following options: Using pak package using devtools package
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("Macrurido/Morefi") library(devtools) install_github("Macrurido/Morefi")

title: Morphological Relationships Fitted by Robust Regression
text: demonstrate package functions, utilize dataset botete_measures.rda, containing 1,405 fish across 7 variables: total length(LT), standard length (SL), body trunk length (LB), total weight (WT), body trunk weight (WB), fillet weight (Wfi) bullseye puffer (Sphoeroides annulatus), collected Eastern Central Pacific. dataset, landing category included “Fleet” variable, categorized follows: 1 indicates Fresh, 2 denotes Frozen-thawed. access data file, data frame stored object, ‘catch’.
code: catch <- Morefi::Botete_land

title: Morphological Relationships Fitted by Robust Regression
text: second dataset Botete_land.rda, provided Mexican fishing records bullseye puffer landed Pacific coast 2023 live weight corresponding live weight weight category (kg): total (WT), body trunk (WB) fillet (Wfi), either Fresh Frozen-thawed (SIPESCA, 2024). access data file, data frame stored mydata.
code: mydata <- Morefi::Botete

title: Morphological Relationships Fitted by Robust Regression
text: Morefi package consists nine functions designed facilitate data analysis ensure results can reproduced. fn_ARSS: Perform Coincident Curves Test, determine significant differences fitted curves database. based Analysis Residual Sum Squares (ARSS) (Chen et al., 1992). fn_dfa: function uses broom::augment() function extract observed values, predictions, residuals, weighted values fitted regression summary. additional column added code errors scale. transforms components tidy tibbles. fn_fig_cs: function creates individual plot displaying fitted model alongside observed values, colored according weighted color scale. fn_fig_e: function creates graph displays residuals vertical axis either independent variable predicted values horizontal axis, determined researcher. residuals color-coded using weighted scale. fn_fig_fw: fitted values models landed presentation category displayed multi-panel plot. observed data points fitted relationship categorized according weighted color scale. fn_fig_w: residual structure analyzed graphing standardized residuals weighted values. custom multi-panel plot illustrates structure fitted relationship, categorized color-weighted scale values. fn_figs: Creates customized scatter plot observed values (points), fitted regression (solid line), confidence interval (shaded area). fn_freq: function calculates frequency distribution data. fn_freqw methodological function calculate percentage frequencies weights model adjusted using robust regression approach. fn_fyield: Calculates fillet yield dividing defined weight reference point bm mean, lower, upper confidence interval 95% (IC95%) estimated fillet weight, respectively. fn_intervals: Calculates non-parametric confidence predicted intervals using function predFit() package investr (version 1.4.2). fn_R2RV: Calculates robust version coefficient determination RRV2R^{2}_{RV} (Renaud & Victoria-Feser, 2010). fn_summary: Customizes stores summary fitted regression. fn_Wlive: live weight, total weight organism, estimated based weights different landing categories, eviscerated weight fillet weight. estimates derived using regression parameters relate total weight weight landing category. fn_xseq: Generates data frame sequence independent variables (including minimum maximum values) selects according model.

title: Morphological Relationships Fitted by Robust Regression
text: Aguirre-Villaseñor, H., Morales-Bojórquez, E., Cisneros-Mata (FISH13711).Biometric relationships fisheries management tool: case study bullseye puffer (Sphoeroides annulatus. Tetraodontidae). Fisheries Research. Chen, Y., Jackson, D. ., Harvey, H. H. 1992. comparison von Bertalanffy polynomial functions modelling fish growth data. Canadian Journal Fisheries Aquatic Sciences 49(6): 1228–1235. https://doi.org/10.1139/f92-13 Maechler M, Rousseeuw P, Croux C, Todorov V, Ruckstuhl , Salibian-Barrera M, Verbeke T, Koller M, Conceicao EL, Anna di Palma M (2024). robustbase: Basic Robust Statistics. R package version 0.99-4-1, http://robustbase.r-forge.r-project.org/. Renaud, O., Victoria-Feser, M. P. (2010). robust coefficient determination regression. what: Records of the bullseye puffer catch landed. — Botete_land
title: Records of the bullseye puffer catch landed. — Botete_land
text: data set provides records bullseye puffer catch landed Pacific coast Mexico 2023. includes information Biomass (live weight) commercial landed presentation : total weight (WT), body trunk weight (WB), fillet weight (Wfi). data also indicates whether catch Fresh Frozen-thawed. Values provided Mexican pesos per landed category per kilogram landed weight (SIPESCA, 2024).

title: Records of the bullseye puffer catch landed. — Botete_land
code: Botete_land

title: Records of the bullseye puffer catch landed. — Botete_land
text: ## `Botete_land` data frame 5 obs.  5 variables: Category Landed presentation. Landed Landed weigth category (g). Biomass Converted landed category weigth total weight (g). Pesos Value Mexican pesos per landed category. Pesos_kg Mean value per kilogram landed weight.

title: Records of the bullseye puffer catch landed. — Botete_land
text: <https://github.com/Macrurido/Morefi.git>

title: Records of the bullseye puffer catch landed. — Botete_land
text: Category includes five commercial landed presentations: whole fresh (WT_Fresh);  body trunk fresh (WB_Fresh), body trunk Fresh-Thawed (WB_Fresh_Thawed); fillet fresh (Wfi_Fresh), sum total (Total).

title: fn_ARSS — fn_ARSS
text: function fn_ARSS perform Coincident Curves Test, determine significant differences fitted curves database.based Analysis Residual Sum Squares (ARSS) (Chen et al. 1992).

title: fn_ARSS — fn_ARSS
code: fn_ARSS(List_TCCT, i, alfa = 0.05)

title: fn_ARSS — fn_ARSS
text: List_TCCT empty list save matrix results regression. integer value indicating ith regression analyzed. alfa numerical value defines significance level. set, default number 0.05.

title: fn_ARSS — fn_ARSS
text: List_TCCT calculations ARSS stored

title: fn_ARSS — fn_ARSS
text: residual sum squares (RSS) degrees freedom (DF) fitted regression stored previously List_TCCT list. Calculations ARSS also stored . Inside function, RSS DF joined sample calculated perform F test two tails alpha/2. decision criteria performed: "*" p-value less equal alpha "NS" p-value greater alpha. function requires defining.

title: fn_ARSS — fn_ARSS
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ i <- 1 List_TCCT <- vector("list", i)  ARSS <- fn_ARSS(List_TCCT, i, alfa = 0.05) } # }

title: fn_R2RV — fn_R2RV
text: consistency corrected robust coefficient determination Renaud Victoria-Feser (2010) allows possible correction factor consistency considerations. Inside function: vectors observed (y1), predicted (yc) weighted (W) values obtained summary model (eq). value Weighted Estimate Average (ywea), modified sum squares explained (SSEw), total (SSTw), residual (SSRw) estimated. correction factor value consistency considerations 95 percent also obtained summary model (eq). vector robust version coefficient determination R2wa adjusted value R2wa_adj returned vector.

title: fn_dfa — fn_dfa
text: `fn_dfa()` function uses `augment()` function `broom` package extract observed values independent variable (x) dependent variable (y), along weights (wi), fitted values (fitt), residuals (ei) summary fitted model. turns components tidy tibbles.

title: fn_dfa — fn_dfa
code: fn_dfa(eq)

title: fn_dfa — fn_dfa
text: eq Summary equation fitted.

title: fn_dfa — fn_dfa
text: tibble data frame provides original data along information model.

title: fn_dfa — fn_dfa
text: function `augment()` provide weights column `lmrob()` function. function `fn_dfa()` contains conditional statement includes variable output data frame linear adjustments. order homogenizes results, columns names renamed "y", "wi","x","fitt","ei". additional column included codes errors using scale based weighted values: unweighted (u), weighted (w), outliers (o) `dfa$scale <- ifelse(df$wi < 0.25, "o", ifelse(df$wi<1, "w", "u"))`. information, please refer help documentation `broom::augment()`.

title: fn_dfa — fn_dfa
code: ## Example 1: robust linear regression  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ df <- df eq <- robustbase::lmrob(y1 ~ x1, data= df,setting = "KS2014")  dfa <- augment(eq) } # }  ## Example 2: robust nonlinear regression if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ df <- df eq <- nlrob(y1 ~ a*x1^b, data= datos, start = list(a= a, b= b), trace = FALSE)  dfa <- augment(eq) } # }

title: fn_freq — fn_freq
text: Yau C (2024, deck 25). Frequency Distribution Quantitative Data. R Tutorial R Introduction Statistics. https://www.r-tutor.com/elementary-statistics/quantitative-data/frequency-distribution-quantitative-data

title: fn_freq — fn_freq
code: # In the df object, 30 random values between 0.1 and 0.9 are generated. # The breaks object is a sequence of equal distances. if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ df <- runif(n=30, min=0, max=1) breaks <- seq(0, 1, by= 0.1) freq <- fn_freq(df, breaks, right= FALSE) } # }

title: fn_freqw — fn_freqw
text: function calculates relative frequency distribution using function `fn_freq` `Morefi` package. `fn_freq`, breaks object must defined. work, sequence breakpoints equal distance used. incorporate number non-weighted values (wi=1), class interval "1" added sequence.

title: fn_freqw — fn_freqw
code: # In the df object, 30 random values between 0.1 and 0.9 are generated and # five values equal to 1 are added. # The breaks object is defined to include non-weighted values (wi=1), weighted # values (wi lower than 1 and equal to or higher than 0.25), and outliers # (wi lower than 0.25).  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ df <- c(runif(n=30, min=0, max=1),rep(1,5)) breaks  <-  c(0, 0.249, 0.99, 1)  freq <- fn_freqw(df, breaks, right=FALSE) } # }
